articles.description: France make the perfect start on their quest for a first Rugby World Cup title as they beat three-time champions New Zealand to delight the Stade de France in Paris.
articles.title: Hosts France make perfect start to stun All Blacks

articles.description: Novak Djokovic beats young American Ben Shelton to reach a 10th US Open final, where he will face Carlos Alcaraz or Daniil Medvedev.
articles.title: Djokovic swats aside Shelton to reach US Open final

articles.description: Scotland are on the brink of qualifying for Euro 2024 after confidently sweeping aside Cyprus in Larnaca to maintain their 100% start in Group A.
articles.title: Scotland on brink of Euros after Cyprus stroll

articles.description: Devon Conway and Daryl Mitchell score unbeaten centuries as New Zealand comfortably win the first one-day international against England in Cardiff.
articles.title: England thrashed by New Zealand in opening ODI

articles.description: Devon Conway and Daryl Mitchell both hit hundreds as New Zealand beat England by eight wickets in the first ODI in Cardiff.
articles.title: New Zealand ease past England in first ODI

articles.description: Manchester United's Antony appears on Brazilian TV to deny allegations of assault saying "I never attacked any woman".
articles.title: Man Utd's Antony appears on TV to deny assaults

articles.description: Former England captain Andrew Flintoff is pictured for the first time since he was injured in an accident while filming Top Gear in last year.
articles.title: Flintoff pictured for first time since Top Gear crash

articles.description: American teenager Coco Gauff meets incoming world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the US Open final as she bids for a first Grand Slam title.
articles.title: Home hope Gauff faces Sabalenka in US Open final

articles.description: Britain's Laura Muir follows up last month's 800m Diamond League win with victory in the 1500m in Brussels.
articles.title: Muir claims second straight Diamond League win

articles.description: Watch as Norwegian star Jakob Ingebrigtsen "smashes" the 2,000m world record, which has stood since 1999, with a time of 4:43:13 at the Diamond League meeting in Brussels.
articles.title: 'Back with a bang!' Ingebrigtsen breaks 2,000m world record
